We work closely with all teams to ensure our clients receive exceptional support and view us as trusted advisors. Our team is eager to learn, help, and find fulfillment in others' success. The Account Manager ensures that clients maximize the value of their technology investments, and that technology contributes to their business efficiency and effectiveness.

As a central part of the firm's plans to further expand its successful banking franchise, the Global Corporate Banking Full-Time Analyst Program offers exciting opportunities as a place to work. Our Public Sector group covers government agencies, central banks, sovereign wealth funds, and multilateral development bank clients around the world. We support our clients tactically in delivering the firm to them and strategically as legislation creates financing opportunities in sustainable projects and initiatives for the public good. We build relationships with clients’ senior leadership including strategic decision makers, investment management, and risk management. Our work is global in terms of geography and firm-wide in terms of products, linkage, and interaction with product, legal, credit and risk teams.


As a Full-Time Analyst within the Global Corporate Banking Public Sector team, you will work with industry experts as a team, drawing from the full spectrum of the firm's resources, to develop customized financial solutions to meet the needs of clients. Analysts work with team members of all seniority levels by assisting them with all client activities (marketing, execution and on-going relationship management). Analysts assume responsibility for managing internal processes for deal executions, internal approvals, business aspects of regulatory reporting and ongoing management of client relationship.


Our Full-Time Analyst Program kicks off with an Investment Banking training program, giving you key technical and practical knowledge. You’ll also attend an additional Credit training program to round out your skills. This combination of training is unique to our program and will provide you with a foundation to advise complex clients across our full product suite.


Our team members and mentors will help you navigate the firm and continue to learn about our businesses. You will be challenged to perform at the highest levels of excellence and are rewarded for your achievements in a demanding environment. Access to senior management and a strong network of peers across the bank will promote ongoing professional development throughout the 2.5 year program.


We have opportunities in **New York, NY**.


We will be filling our classes on a rolling basis. We strongly encourage you to submit your application as early as possible.


**Job Responsibilities**

* Working alongside Bankers and Product Partners to execute transactions from initial pitch through marketing to close
* Preparing marketing materials for use in client meetings covering topics such as financing alternatives, working capital optimization and industry analysis
* Coordinating with product and coverage partners to produce and distribute client deliverables
* Maintaining internal reports including deal tracking, pipeline reports, and balance sheet memos
* Developing an understanding of the full breadth of J.P. Morgan products and service offerings and relevant clients. This includes in-depth research and an understanding of the entire universe of clients and prospects, buying behaviors, revenue drivers, business models, internal products, competitors, economic outlook and industry developments, trends and challenges
* Assisting with the organization of client seminars and training

**Required qualifications, capabilities and skills**

* Attend college/university in the U.S.
* Expected graduation date of December 2024 – June 2025 from Bachelor’s or Master’s program
	+ If you are pursuing a Master’s degree, it must be within 2 years of receiving your Bachelor’s degree.
* Ability to achieve quality results in a high-pressure, fast-paced, rapidly changing environment requiring flexibility / adaptability to changeable directives
* A team player passionate about public sector institutions and a high level of motivation to learn about and work with public sector clients
* A collaborative mindset and willingness to partner and work on a team
* Exceptional analytical, research and project management skills
* Excellent problem solving, prioritization, and critical thinking skills
* Strong attention to detail
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* To be eligible for this program, you must be authorized to work in the U.S. We do not offer any type of employment-based immigration sponsorship for this program. Likewise, JPMorgan Chase & Co., will not provide any assistance or sign any documentation in support of any other form of immigration sponsorship or benefit including optional practical training (OPT) or curricular practical training (CPT).




**Preferred qualifications, capabilities and skills**

* Minimum preferred cumulative GPA of 3.2 on a 4.0 scale
* Coursework in finance, accounting, economics, international economic relations and/or any other public policy related subject a plus
* General understanding of financial markets and economic data and trends
* Fluency in Spanish would be highly preferable

As a Compliance Risk Management Lead within the J.P. Morgan Wealth Management’s Solutions Compliance Group, you will be a part of an innovative and talented team supporting the Global Private Bank's Solutions business. You will need to possess operational and regulatory knowledge and experience with managed account and retirement products and services and will be expected to strategically partner with the business and other control functions to ensure that practices, processes, and controls are in compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations.


You will also be responsible for related policies, risk and control assessments, monitoring and testing, and training. The OCIO team works with endowments, foundations and family offices around the globe advising on and implementing tailored endowment-style investment solutions.

* Advise the business on compliance issues relevant to new and existing defined contribution and managed account products and services

description:
CHEQ is the global leader in Go-to-Market Security, trusted by over 15,000 customers worldwide to protect every aspect of their marketing, sales and data operation from bots, fake users, fraud and cyber attacks.

  

Powered by award-winning cybersecurity technology, CHEQ offers the broadest suite of solutions for securing the entire funnel, from paid marketing to on-site conversion, data and analytics.

  

CHEQ is a global company with offices in Tel-Aviv, New York, London and Tokyo.

  

As a Business Development Representative (BDR) at CHEQ you will play a key role as we expand our fast-growing US business.

  

You will report into our BDR Manager and will work closely with our marketing and sales teams to find, qualify and target opportunities.

  

This will be done with various outbound efforts and targeting accounts that will help grow our sales pipeline.

 **﻿Responsibilities:**

* Nurture, educate and qualify outbound leads to create sales-ready opportunities via phone and email, social selling etc
* Research accounts prior to first contact to understand the prospect needs and educate the prospect on the huge problem that CHEQ’s platform can solve
* Perform outbound cold calling targeting companies that meet CHEQ’s customer profile
* Become a credible resource and develop trusted relationships with prospects
* Work closely with Sales Managers to identify and uncover opportunities at target accounts
* Identify opportunities to hand-off to the Sales Account Executive for further follow-up
* Responsible for meeting BDR metrics and assigned goals
* Responsible for managing leads through a defined process

  

Requirements:
  

* Minimum 1 year of lead qualification/business development experience within a technology company, in support of providing qualified leads to the sales organization
* Experience in outbound cold calling targeting multiple-level contacts including executive management
* Experience selling to VP and CxO
* Excellent lead follow-up skills responding to and qualifying leads from marketing-generated campaigns and incoming phone and web inquiries
* Experience in prospecting, nurturing, educating, and qualifying target prospects to create sales-ready opportunities
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage time and resources effectively
* Superior pre-call planning, opportunity qualification and objection handling skills
* Superb communications skills, both verbal and written, with an ability to demonstrate products highlighting benefits/advantages/features
* Self-starter, with high-energy, positive phone presence
* Ability to work in a hybrid environment that requires in-office teamwork at least 3 days a week

 *The OTE pay range for this position is 70,000$ - 80,000$ per year. The determination of what a specific employee in this job classification is paid depends on a number of factors, including, but not limited to, prior employment history/job-related knowledge, qualifications and skills, length of service, and geographic location.*
